revised_title: The Absence of Suprarenal Medulla in Teleostean Fishes
tldr: The author investigates the effects of extirpation of the suprarenal bodies in eels and finds that they can survive longer without these bodies compared to mammals and frogs. This suggests that the cortical suprarenal gland in Teleostean fishes is not absolutely essential to the life of the animal, unlike in higher vertebrates.
